title: Mounting device, information processing device, mounting method, and information processing method

invention-title.#text: Mounting device, information processing device, mounting method, and information processing method

nplcit.othercit: International Search Report dated Feb. 6, 2018 in PCT/JP2017/044783 filed Dec. 13, 2017, 2 pages.

abstract: A mounting device comprises: a mounting head having multiple pickup members configured to pick up components; a mounting control section configured to cause a second component to be picked up later when a first component, held by the mounting head at a predetermined height, and the second component, held by the mounting head at a lowered position lower than the predetermined height, are picked up with the mounting head; the mounting control section being configured to cause the second component to be released earlier when the mounting head, having picked up the first component and the second component, releases a component.
description: This specification discloses a mounting device, an information processing device, a mounting method, and an information processing method.

Conventionally, a device having a rotary head has been proposed as a mounting device in which multiple pick-up nozzles are circumferentially attached to a rotary body, and while the rotary body rotates, the rotary head picks up components at a first position and a second position (see, for example, Patent Literature 1). Since components can be picked up at multiple positions, throughput is improved with this device.
Patent Literature 1: U.S. Pat. No. 6,177,342

However, in the mounting device of Patent Literature 1, picking up a large-sized component, such as interfering with an adjacent pick-up nozzle or a component picked up by an adjacent nozzle, was not considered. In Patent Literature 1, throughput is improved by picking up components at multiple positions, but this is still not sufficient, and there has been a demand to improve the production efficiency when such large components are picked up.

It is an object of the present disclosure to provide a mounting device, an information processing device, a mounting method, and an information processing method capable of further improving production efficiency.

The mounting device, the information processing device, the mounting method, and the information processing method disclosed in this specification adopt the following means to achieve the main object described above.

The mounting device disclosed in this specification comprises: a mounting head having multiple pickup members configured to pick up components; a mounting control section configured to cause a second component to be picked up later when a first component, held by the mounting head at a predetermined height, and the second component, held by the mounting head at a lowered position lower than the predetermined height, are picked up with the mounting head; while to cause the second component to be released earlier when the mounting head, having picked up the first component and the second component, releases a component.

This mounting device causes a second component to be picked up later when a first component, held by the mounting head at a predetermined height, and the second component, held by the mounting head at a lowered position lower than the predetermined height, are picked up by the mounting head; and the mounting control section causes the second component to be released earlier when the mounting head, having picked up the first component and the second component, releases a component. In this mounting device, since the second component is held at a lowered position, it is possible to prevent interference with an adjacent pickup member, a first component picked up by an adjacent pickup member, or the like. Therefore, for example, the first component and the second component larger than the first component can be held and moved in the same step. Further, picking up the second component first may interfere with picking up the first component, but here, since the second component is picked up after the first component, the first component and the second component can be picked up without interference. Similarly, picking up a nearby first component while second component is held may cause interference with the second component, but here, since the second component is released preferentially, the first component and the second component can be released without interference. As described above, in this mounting device, since the first component and the second component can be picked up, held, and released without interference, the production efficiency can be further improved. Here, the “predetermined height” and the “lowered position” may be, for example, determined empirically to have heights that do not interfere with other members while components are held. The “pickup member” may be a pick-up nozzle that picks up a component by pressure, or may be a mechanical chuck that grasps and picks up a component.

The present embodiment will be described below with reference to the drawings.  is a schematic diagram showing an example of mounting system  of the present disclosure.  is a diagram of mounting head .  is a diagram showing mounting head  picking up components P at the same time.  is a figure showing an example of mounting-condition information  stored in storage section . Mounting system  is, for example, a system that executes a mounting process involved in the process of mounting component P on board S. Mounting system  includes mounting device  and management computer (PC) , Mounting system  is configured as a mounting line in which multiple mounting devices  are arranged from upstream to downstream. In , only one mounting device  is shown for convenience of explanation. In the present embodiment, the left-right direction (X-axis), the front-rear direction (Y-axis), and the up-down direction (Z-axis) are as shown in ,

As shown in , mounting device  includes board processing section , component supply section , component imaging section , nozzle storage section , mounting section , and mounting control section . Board processing section  is a unit for loading, conveying, and fixing board S at a mounting position, and carrying out board S. Board processing section  has a pair of conveyor belts suspended in the right-left direction of , spaced apart in the front-rear direction. Board S is conveyed by the conveyor belts.

Component supply section  includes multiple feeders  having reels and a tray unit, and is detachably attached to the front side of mounting device . A tape is wound around each reel, and multiple components P are held on the surface of the tape along the longitudinal direction of the tape. The tape is unwound rearward from the reel and, while the components are exposed, fed by the feeder section to a pickup position where components are picked up by pick-up nozzle . The tray section has a tray on which multiple components are arranged and placed, and the tray unit moves the tray in and out of a predetermined pickup position.

Component imaging section  is a device for capturing an image, and is a unit for imaging one or more components P picked up and held by mounting head . Component imaging section  is disposed between component supply section  and board processing section . The imaging range of component imaging section  lies above component imaging section . When mounting head  holding component P passes over component imaging section , component imaging section  captures an image thereof and outputs the captured image data to mounting control section .

Nozzle storage section  stores multiple pick-up nozzles  of multiple types in storage holes. Mounting head  performs a mounting process by exchanging pick-up nozzles  stored in nozzle storage section  according to the type of board S on which component P is to be mounted and the type of component P.

Mounting section  picks up component P from component supply section  and positions component P on board S secured to board processing section . Mounting section  includes head moving section , mounting head , holding body , nozzle holder , and pick-up nozzle . Head moving section  includes a slider that is guided by guide rails and moves in the XY-direction and a motor that drives the slider. Mounting head  is detachably attached to the slider and is moved in the XY direction by head moving section . One or more pick-up nozzles  are detachably attached to the lower face of mounting head  via holding body . Multiple pick-up nozzles  of any one of multiple types are mounted on holding body . Multiple pick-up nozzles  (e.g., 16 sections, 8 sections, 4 sections, etc.) are attached to holding body  via nozzle holder , and multiple components P can be picked up at one time. Pick-up nozzles  are pickup members configured to pick up a component by making use of negative pressure or a vacuum and are detachably attached to mounting head  via corresponding nozzle holders .

Mounting head  is configured as a rotary-type working head that rotatably holds holding body . As shown in , holding body  of mounting head  includes head main body  attached to X-axis slider, and engagement shaft  disposed below head main body . Holding body  includes rotary portion , which is a cylindrical member, R-axis gear , which is disposed below rotary portion , Q-axis gear , which is disposed above rotary portion , and multiple long cylindrical nozzle holders  to which pick-up nozzles  are attached at their lower ends. Head main body  is provided with R-axis motor  for rotating rotary portion , Q-axis motor  for rotating pick-up nozzle , and Z-axis motor  for moving the push-down portion  to raise and lower pick-up nozzle . The rotation axis of rotary portion  is referred to as the R-axis, and the rotation axis of each pick-up nozzle  is referred to as a Q-axis. Engagement shaft  is rotatably disposed in head main body  and is inserted into a bottomed hole, formed at the center of Q-axis gear , to engage with holding body . Rotary portion  is, for example, a cylindrical member configured to rotate about the center axis of nozzle holders  and support multiple nozzle holders  in an up-down movable manner. R-axis gear  is a disk-shaped member having an outer diameter larger than the diameter of rotary portion , with gear grooves formed on the outer peripheral surface, R-axis gear  engages with small gear  connected to the rotation shaft of R-axis motor  and is rotationally driven by R-axis motor  via small gear . Q-axis gear  is a cylindrical member having an outer diameter smaller than the diameter of rotary portion , with gear grooves formed on the outer peripheral surface. Nozzle holder  is a member in which small gear  is disposed on the upper end and pick-up nozzle  is attached to the lower end. Small gear  engages with gear grooves on the outer periphery of Q-axis gear . Nozzle holders  are arranged at equal intervals along the outer periphery of Q-axis gear . Nozzle holder  rotates about its rotation axis (Q-axis) by the driving force of Q-axis motor  transmitted through small gear , connected to Q-axis motor , Q-axis gear , and small gear , disposed on the upper end of each nozzle holder , and the angle of the picked up component P can be adjusted. In mounting head , all nozzle holders  rotate in synchronization with the rotation of Q-axis gear . Nozzle holder  is moved up and down in the Z-axis direction by the driving force of Z-axis motor  transmitted through push-down portion . In mounting head , nozzle holder  is lifted and lowered in the Z-axis direction at two positions (see ): first lifting/lowering position A located at the left end and second lifting/lowering position B located at the right end in the X-axis direction, That is, mounting head  has two lowered positions for lowering pick-up nozzles . Mounting head  can pick up multiple components P from component supply section  in the same step with multiple pick-up nozzles . It should be noted that “in the same step” means, for example, a step in which mounting head  picks up one or more components P, arranges (and discards) components P, and moves to the next pickup position.

As shown in , mounting control section  is configured as a microprocessor with CPU  at its center as a control section and includes storage section  for storing various data. Mounting control section  outputs control signals to board processing section , component supply section , component imaging section , and mounting section , and receives signals from mounting section , component supply section , and component imaging section . Storage section  stores mounting condition information  including the order of picking up and releasing components P, component types (ID), pick-up nozzles  to be used, positioning coordinates, and information on whether holding at a lowered position is necessary. Since mounting condition information  is acquired from management PC  and stored in storage section , the content is the same as the content of mounting condition information  of management PC  (see ).

Management PC  is a computer that manages data of each device of mounting system . As shown in , management PC  includes control device , storage section , a display, and an inputting device. Control device  is configured as a microprocessor with CPU  at its center serving as a control section. Storage section  is a device, such as an HDD, for storing various data such as a processing program. The display is a liquid crystal screen for displaying various types of information. The input device includes a keyboard, a mouse, and the like through which an operator inputs various commands. Storage section  stores component information  and mounting condition information . As shown in , component information  is information linked to the component type (ID), and includes various information, such as the size and type of the component handled by mounting device , the type of pick-up nozzle for being available, and information on necessity of holding a component at a lowered position. Mounting condition information  is a mounting job used for the mounting process of component P and includes content equivalent to the content of mounting condition information  described above.

Next, the operation of mounting system  of the present embodiment configured as described above, in particular, the state in which mounting head  holds components P will be described.  is a diagram showing an example in which general-purpose component P and large-sized component Pa are picked up.  is a diagram showing pick-up nozzles  holding general-purpose component P at reference height H (a predetermined height), which is a reference height for holding components P in a normal manner, and large-sized component Pa at lowered position H. Mounting device  performs, with mounting head , a process of picking up general-purpose component P (first component) and large-sized component Pa (second component) in the same step and positioning them on board S. Here, general-purpose component P and large-sized component Pa are collectively referred to as components P, Reference height H and lowered position H may be, for example, determined empirically to have heights that do not interfere with other members while components P are held. General-purpose component P has, for example, a size and a shape that does not interfere with adjacent pick-up nozzles  or components P while general-purpose component P is being picked up by pick-up nozzle . In mounting head , all of components P being held rotate synchronously about the central axis of the pick-up nozzles . Therefore, in mounting head , as shown by the dotted circle in , care is taken so that each component does not interfere with rotation regions obtained by adding a predetermined margin to the component size of each component. Large-sized component Pa is, for example, a component having a size that interferes with the tip of adjacent pick-up nozzle  and/or component P held at the tip of adjacent pick-up nozzle  when large-sized component Pa is picked up by pick-up nozzle  and held at reference height Hi. As shown in , large-sized component Pa is set as a lowered-position held component held at lowered position H lower than reference height H, and information of “necessary” is given to lowered-position held of component information  (see ). In the mounting device, large-sized component Pa was not held in the same step as general-purpose component P, but in mounting device , as many components P as possible are held in the same step.

Next, the operation of mounting system  of the present embodiment configured as described above, in particular, the process of picking up components P and setting the placement order of components P in management PC  will be described. Here, details of the operation is described in view of a case where eight pick-up nozzles  can be attached to mounting head , and lowered position at which component P can be picked up is “Position ”.  is a flowchart showing an example of a mounting-condition setting process routine executed by CPU  of management PC . This routine is stored in storage section  and executed based on an operator's mounting-condition creation start input. When this routine is started, CPU  first acquires information on components P mounted on board S by mounting device  and provisionally sets the placement order of components P based on a predetermined priority order (S). For example, CPU  may specify components P from information of board S to be produced, such as CAD data, and acquire information for each component P. Further, the predetermined priority order may be determined by prioritizing one or more of the followings based on experience, such as multiple components P that can be simultaneously picked up, components P which result in a shorter moving distance of mounting head , components P yielding a smaller number of exchanges of pick-up nozzles , and the like.

Next, CPU  selects component P in order from the top of the provisionally set placement order (S), and determines whether the selected component P is a lowered-position held component (S). CPU  determines whether the component is a lowered-position held component based on the lowered-position held information included in component information . If selected component P is not a lowered-position held component, CPU  determines whether pick-up nozzle  at another position is available to pick up the component in the same step (S), and if a pick-up nozzle is available to pick up the component, executes S and subsequent processes. That is, the components are selected until there is no pick-up nozzle  available to perform a pick up, and the maximum number of components P that can be picked up in the same step is set. When the step includes large-sized component Pa, components P cannot be held by the two adjacent pick-up nozzles  (see ), in which case, CPU  determines that the maximum number of pick-up nozzles  that can be picked up is . On the other hand, when component P is a lowered-position held component in S, CPU  determines whether a lowered position is available (S). In mounting head , the lowered position is “Position ”, and two pick-up nozzles , can be lowered at the same time. This determination is made so as not to set lowered-position held components exceeding the number of lowered positions in the same step. When a lowered position is available, CPU  performs S and subsequent processes. On the other hand, when a lowered position is not available, CPU  removes the selected component from the same step, performs a process of incorporating the selected component into a later step (S), and performs the process of S and subsequent processes,

When other positions are not available in S, CPU  determines that the number of components that can be held in the same step is maximized, and performs a process of changing the pickup and pickup-release order in the same step as required (S to S).  is a figure showing an example of changing the order of picking up and releasing large-sized component Pa,  is a table showing a provisionally set initial order of picking up and releasing large-sized component Pa, and  is a table showing the order of picking up and releasing after the change in the order. In this process, CPU  determines whether there is a lowered-position held component among the selected components P (S), and when there is no lowered-position held component, CPU  sets the current component order as same as the order of picking up and releasing in the same step. For example, since the pickup order  to  in  does not include the lowered-position held component, in this step, the pickup order and the pickup-release order are determined without change (). On the other hand, when there is a lowered-position held component among the selected components P, the order is changed to an order which makes such a lowered-position held component to be held later with the lowered position, and thereby the pickup order is set (S). Here, the correspondence between the constituent elements of the present embodiment and the constituent elements of the present disclosure will be specified. Mounting head  of the present embodiment corresponds to the mounting head of the present disclosure, mounting control section  corresponds to the mounting control section, and control device  corresponds to the setting control section. In the present embodiment, an example of the mounting method and the information processing method of the present disclosure is also specified by describing the operations of mounting control section  and control device .

In mounting device  of the present embodiment described above, when the mounting head picks up general-purpose component P (first component) held by mounting head  at reference height H and large-sized component Pa (second component) held by mounting head  at lowered position H lower than reference height H the second component is picked up later, and when component P is released from mounting head  that has picked up the first component and the second component, the second component is released earlier. In mounting device , since the second component is held at lowered position H, it is possible to prevent interference with adjacent pick-up nozzle , component P picked up by adjacent pick-up nozzle , or the like. Therefore, for example, the first component and the second component can be held and moved in the same step. Further, picking up the second component first may interfere with picking up the first component, but here, since the second component is picked up after the first component, the first component and the second component can be picked up without interference. Similarly, picking up a nearby first component while second component is held may cause interference with the second component, but here, since the second component is released preferentially, the first component and the second component can be released without interference. As described above, in mounting device , since the first component and the second component can be picked up, held, and released without interference, the production efficiency can be further improved.

Mounting head  is a rotary head having a rotary portion  (cylindrical portion) that rotates on an axis, and pick-up nozzles  are attached on the circumference within rotary portion , and picks up and releases components P while rotating rotary portion . Mounting control section  does not rotate rotary portion  after the second component is picked up, but rotates rotary portion  after the second component is released. Therefore, in mounting device , since rotary portion  is not rotated while holding the second component, component P is held more reliably. Further, mounting head  has two or more lowered positions to which pick-up nozzle  is lowered, and mounting control section  causes pick-up nozzle  of the lowered position to pick up the second component at the end of the same step in which mounting head  is caused to pick up multiple components P, and mounting control section  causes pick-up nozzles  at the lowered position to release components earlier starting from the second component held at lowered position H. In mounting device , since multiple lowered positions can be effectively utilized, the production efficiency can be further improved. Furthermore, mounting control section  causes pick-up nozzle  at the lower position to pick up the second component, and then causes pick-up nozzle  at the other lower position to pick up the second component when picking up the other second component. In mounting device , since multiple second components can be picked up, the production efficiency can be further improved.

Further, for he component-to-be-repositioned or the like, mounting control section  sets the pickup order in which a second component is picked up by pick-up nozzle  after a first component, and sets the pickup-release order in which a second component is picked by pick-up nozzle  before a first component. In mounting device , the pickup order and the pickup-release order can be set, for example, even when a change in the mounting order becomes necessary later, the first component and the second component can be mixed and then picked up and released, thereby making it possible to further improve production efficiency. Furthermore, the second component is a large-sized component that interferes with the tip of adjacent pick-up nozzle  and/or a first component held at the tip of adjacent pick-up nozzle  when a second component is picked up by pick-up nozzle  and held at reference height H In mounting device , production efficiency can be further improved when a large-sized component is involved.

It should be noted that the mounting device and the information processing device of the present disclosure are not limited to the embodiments described above, and may be implemented in various modes as long as they fall within the technical scope of the present disclosure.

For example, in the embodiment described above, mounting head  has rotary portion , but is not particularly limited thereto as long as mounting head  holds component P at lowered position H and need not have rotary portion . Further, although mounting head  has two lowered positions, the present disclosure is not particularly limited thereto, and mounting head  may have three or more lowered positions or may have only one lowered position. Further, mounting head  has been described as rotating all nozzle holders  at the same time, but the present disclosure is not particularly limited thereto, and nozzle holders  may be configured to rotate individually.

In the embodiment described above, mounting device  and management PC  set the pickup order and the pickup-release order, but the present disclosure is not particularly limited thereto, and any one of the devices may set the pickup order and any one of the devices may set the pickup-release order. Also in this mounting system , it is possible to obtain the same effect as in the above-described embodiment.

In the embodiment described above, large-sized component Pa is used as the lowered-position held component, but the present disclosure is not particularly limited thereto as long as it is a component that needs to be held at the lowered position. Although general-purpose component P is the first component, it may be a special component as long as it can be held at reference height H.

In the embodiment described above, pick-up nozzle  has been described as a pickup member, but the present disclosure is not particularly limited thereto as long as the pickup member picks up component P, and the pickup member may be, for example, a mechanical chuck that grasps and picks up component P.

In the mounting device of the present disclosure, the mounting head is a rotary head having a cylindrical portion that rotates on an axis with the pickup members being attached to the circumference of the cylindrical portion, and is configured to pick up and release components while the cylindrical portion is rotated; and the mounting control section does not rotate the cylindrical portion after picking up the second component but rotates the cylindrical portion after releasing the second component. In this mounting device, since the cylindrical portion is not rotated while holding the second component in the rotary head, the component can be held more reliably.

In the mounting device of the present disclosure, the mounting head may have two or more lowered positions to which the pickup member is lowered; and the mounting control section causes the pickup member of the lowered position to pick up the second component at the end of the same step in which the mounting head is caused to pick up multiple components, and the mounting control section causes pickup members at the lowered position to release components earlier starting from the second component at the lowered position. Since multiple lowered positions can be effectively utilized with this mounting device, the production efficiency can be further improved. Here, “in the same step” means, for example, a step in which the mounting head picks up one or more components, and then positions (and discards) the components and move to the next pickup position.

In the mounting device of the present disclosure, the mounting head may have two or more lowered positions for lowering the pickup member, and when, after picking up the second component with the pickup member at the lowered position, the mounting control section picks up another second component, the mounting control section may pick up said second component with the pickup member of another lowered position. Since multiple second components can be picked up with this mounting device, the production efficiency can be further improved.

In the mounting device of the present disclosure, the mounting control section may set a pickup order in which the pickup member picks up the second component after the first component, and set a pickup-release order in which the second component is released from the pickup member before the first component. In this mounting device, the pickup order and the pickup-release order can be set, for example, even when a change in the mounting order becomes necessary later, the first component and the second component can be mixed and then picked up and released, thereby making it possible to improve the production efficiency.

In the mounting device of the present disclosure, the second component may be a large-sized component that interferes with the tip of an adjacent pickup member and/or the first component held by the tip of the adjacent pickup member when picked up by a pickup member and held at a predetermined height. In this mounting device, the production efficiency can be further improved in the case where a large-sized component is involved.

The information processing device of the present disclosure is an information processing device for use in a mounting system comprising a mounting device provided with a mounting head having multiple pickup members configured to pick up a component: the mounting device being configured to pick up and perform a mounting process on the components: the information processing device comprising: a setting control section configured to set a pickup order for picking up a second component later when a first component held by the mounting head at a predetermined height and a second component held by the mounting head at a lowered position lower than the predetermined height are picked up by the mounting head; and the setting control section is configured to set a pickup-release order for releasing the second component earlier when a component is released from the mounting head in which the first component and the second component are held.

This information processing device can pick up, hold, and release the first component and the second component without interference, and can hold and move the first component and the second component in the same step, thereby making it possible to further improve the production efficiency, similarly to the mounting device described above. In this information processing device, various modes of the mounting device described above may be adopted, or a configuration for achieving each function of the mounting device described above may be added.

The mounting method of the present disclosure is a mounting method for use in a mounting device provided with a mounting head having multiple pickup members configured to pick up components, the mounting device being configured to pick up and perform a mounting process on the components; the mounting method comprising: (a) a step of picking up a second component later when the mounting head picks up a first component held at a predetermined height and the second component held at a lowered position lower than a predetermined height, and (b) a step of releasing the second component earlier when a component is released from the mounting head having picked up the first component and the second component.

In this mounting method, similarly to the mounting device described above, the first component and the second component can be picked up, held, and released without interference, and the first component and the second component can be held and moved in the same step, making it possible to further improve the production efficiency. In this mounting method, various aspects of the mounting device described above may be adopted, or steps for achieving each function of the mounting device described above may be added.

The information processing method of the present disclosure is an information processing method used in a mounting system comprising a mounting device provided with a mounting head having multiple pickup members configured to pick up components; the information processing method comprising (a) a step of setting a pickup order for picking up a second component later when the mounting head picks up a first component held by the mounting head at a predetermined height and the second component held by the mounting head at a lowered position lower than the predetermined height, and (b) a step of setting a pickup-release order for releasing the second component earlier when a component is released from the mounting head having picked up the first component and the second component.

In this information processing method, similarly to the information processing device described above, the first component and the second component can be picked up, held, and released without interference, and the first component and the second component can be held and moved in the same step, thereby making it possible to further improve the production efficiency. In this information processing method, various aspects of the information processing device described above may be adopted, or steps for achieving the functions of the information processing device described above may be added.
